definition: to take one's leave/to bid farewell
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: Your tactful to leave by boat.
sentences.chinese: 你委婉的作别，乘船离去。

sentences.english: The clouds, they were the same as I left them in my country.
sentences.chinese: 云，它们还和我在自己的国家与它们作别时一模一样。

sentences.english: I felt very embarrassed so I was ready to leave in a hurry without a word of apology or goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 我十分尴尬，于是就想立即离往，不道歉，也不作别。

sentences.english: Whether or not extraterrestrial entities are visiting earth is an argument for another time and place.
sentences.chinese: 是否有外星生物造访过地球的争论日后另作别论。

sentences.english: And you say goodbye, not once hurt geometry.
sentences.chinese: 与你作别，不问曾经伤痛几何。

definition: I'm sure we'll meet again some day. (idiom)/Hope to see you again.
to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
precious/extremely valuable/(honorific) Please take good care of yourself!
to see each other/to meet in person
